explanations.low: System uptime is {state}; within acceptable range.
explanations.medium: System uptime is {state}; exceeds {lowMax} days, consider a reboot to apply security patches.
explanations.high: System uptime is {state}; over {medMax} days without reboot. Security patches may be pending.

Defender.explanation: Windows Defender is disabled. System is unprotected from malware.

Firewall.explanation: Windows Firewall is disabled. System is exposed to network attacks.

auto_not_running.explanation: Auto-start service {name} is not running. Dependent features may fail.

suspicious_path.explanation: Service {name} runs from suspicious location: {path}. Potential malware.

error_states.explanation: Scheduled task {name} is in error state: {state}. May indicate system issue or malware.

not_ready.explanation: Scheduled task {name} status is {state}. Check if this is expected.

default.explanation: WMI binding {name} detected. WMI persistence is commonly used by malware.

consumer_binding.explanation: WMI event-to-consumer binding {name} detected. This is a common malware persistence technique.

default.explanation: Startup item {name} configured to run at boot.

suspicious_location.explanation: Startup item {name} runs from suspicious location. Likely malware.

script_execution.explanation: Startup item {name} executes a script. Verify this is legitimate.

suspicious_port.explanation: Connection to suspicious port detected. Common malware/hacking tool port.

external_connection.explanation: External network connection from {name}. Verify this is expected behavior.

suspicious_tool.explanation: Suspicious security tool {name} detected. Potential attacker activity.

suspicious_path.explanation: Process {name} running from suspicious location. Potential malware.

high_resource.explanation: Process {name} consuming high resources. May be cryptominer or resource abuse.

script_execution.explanation: Registry persistence with script execution: {name}. Common malware technique.

suspicious_path.explanation: Registry entry {name} points to suspicious location. Potential malware persistence.
